clinical_study.brief_title: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation for Chronic Functional Constipation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Fecal Microbiota Transplantation on Chronic Functional Constipation and Its Mechanism

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic functional constipation is a common digestive system disease, the incidence is increasing in recent years.It is reported that the occurrence and development of chronic functional constipation is closely related to imbalance of intestinal flora .Moreover,types and quantity of intestinal flora may be related to intestinal motility. Fecal microbiota transplantation as a new technology to rebuild intestinal flora has been used for several diseaseï¼Œbut the clinical efficacy of chronic functional constipation by fecal microbiota transplantation needs to be further explored.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who meet the inclusion crit chronic functional constipation will be separated into two parts depending on acceptation or refuse of Fecal microbiota transplantation.Blood specimen from patients will be collected to analysis intestinal motility.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events complication rate in all patients in both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of bowel movements per week

secondary_outcome.description: Constipation-related symptoms were evaluated using the validated Patient Assessment of Constipation Symptoms (PAC-SYM) questionnaire at week 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Usage of laxatives or enemas as rescue medication
Histological changes in the intestinal biopsy in both groups.

arm_group.description: Fecal microbiota transplantation and traditional treatments will be used in patients with chronic functional constipation in part 1.
The traditional treatments and normal saline will be used in patients with chronic functional constipation in part 2 according to associated guidelines.

intervention.description: Fecal Microbiota Transplantation and the traditional treatments for chronic functional constipation in part 1.
Normal saline and the traditional treatments for chronic functional constipation in part 2

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College
